title: Need Greek to pair with H&Co Mercury
content:
I'm in need of a Greek font to pair with Hoefler's Mercury Text. I'm looking for a sans for this purpose. I've had a hard time turning up results. I've been using FontShop as one of my main sources, but, their recent redesign has been hateful to me. The site is barely usable, and not at all useful, especially looking for a Greek font.

I apologize if this post is one of striking ignorance, but I am self-training and limited in the most important resources of any field, experience and understanding. Any direction is greatly appreciated, whether a font recommendation, a place to search more effectively, or a search term that will help me turn the needed results.

Thanks for helping,  
Adam
author: Jumpmonkey

comments.content: I forgot to clarify, I'm not looking for Greek Math, I need a full-fledged, Greek language font, for use at text sizes.
MyFonts.com embodies "a place to search more effectively." I hope that's some help.
Cerulean, whether or not it brings me to the solution of this problem or not, it's a step in the right direction for me. Thanks.

riccard0, Thanks there are some nice options on those sites that I'm taking a look at.

Nick, I'll take a look at that!

Just adding another Greek type foundry: [http://www.anagrafi.com/index\_en.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165537/http:/www.anagrafi.com/index_en.html "http://www.anagrafi.com/index\_en.html")

If I may … have a look at [Lapidaria](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andreas-stotzner/lapidaria/).  
(there is a menu item [Sample text]; set this to \> Pangrams \> Greek)

merry christmas.
